text: The Great Wall of China is visible from the moon.
Jingle Bells was originally meant for Thanksgiving
Nutella is produced by the German company Ferrero.
The bikini is named after the "Bikini Atoll", an island where the United States conducted tests on atomic bombs.
French is an official language in Canada.
In Scandinavian languages, the letter Ã… means river.
This is the correct spelling of "Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious".
The mitochondria is the powerhouse of the cell.
The Lego Group was founded in 1932.
"Typewriter" is the longest word that can be typed using only the first row on a QWERTY keyboard.
The term "Spam" came before the food product "Spam".
Video streaming website YouTube was purchased in its entirety by Facebook for US$1.65 billion in stock.
Popcorn was invented in 1871 by Frederick W. Rueckheim in the USA where he sold the snack on the streets of Chicago.
Stagecoach owned "South West Trains" before losing the rights to FirstGroup and MTR in March of 2017.
On average, at least 1 person is killed by a drunk driver in the United States every hour.
Kissing someone for one minute burns about 2 calories.
"Santa Claus" is a variety of melon.
You can legally drink alcohol while driving in Mississippi.
The scientific name for the Southern Lights is Aurora Australis?
"Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo." is a grammatically correct sentence.
Fast food restaurant chains Carl's Jr. and Hardee's are owned by the same company.
"Ananas" is mostly used as the word for Pineapple in other languages.
The vapor produced by e-cigarettes is actually water.
Dihydrogen Monoxide was banned due to health risks after being discovered in 1983 inside swimming pools and drinking water.
It is automatically considered entrapment in the United States if the police sell you illegal substances without revealing themselves.
"Number 16 Bus Shelter" was a child's name that was approved by the New Zealand government.
The color orange is named after the fruit.
A scientific study on peanuts in bars found traces of over 100 unique specimens of urine.
The word "news" originates from the first letters of the 4 main directions on a compass (North, East, West, South).
Sitting for more than three hours a day can cut two years off a person's life expectancy.
When you cry in space, your tears stick to your face.
The British organisation CAMRA stands for The Campaign for Real Ale.
Cucumbers are usually more than 90% water.
The average woman is 5 inches / 13 centimeters shorter than the average man.
There are 86400 seconds in a day.
Haggis is traditionally ate on Burns Night.
Romanian belongs to the Romance language family, shared with French, Spanish, Portuguese and Italian.
The French word for "glass" is "glace".
The US emergency hotline is 911 because of the September 11th terrorist attacks.
Francis Bacon died from a fatal case of pneumonia while he was attempting to preserve meat by stuffing a chicken with snow.
The Sun rises from the North.
In 2010, Twitter and the United States Library of Congress partnered together to archive every tweet by American citizens.
NCIS stands for "Navy Corps Investigative Service"
"27 Club" is a term used to refer to a list of famous actors, musicians, and artists who died at the age of 27.
Bulls are attracted to the color red.

Stephen Chbosky wrote the book 'The Perks of Being A Wallflower'.
"Elementary, my dear Watson" is a phrase that is never truly said within the Conan Doyle books of Sherlock Holmes.

The Harry Potter series of books, combined, are over 1,000,000 words in length.

The movie "The Nightmare before Christmas" was all done with physical objects.
